quote: [What guided Einstein was that, in his mid-twenties, he found the unknown intriguing. He felt compelled to comprehend what might have been intended for our universe by The Old One (as he referred to his notion of God).] We are in the position, ... of a little child entering a huge library, whose walls are covered to the ceiling with books in many different languages. The child knows that someone must have written those books. It does not know who or how. It does not understand the languages in which they are written. quote: When the eyes say one thing, and the tongue another, a practised man relies on the language of the first

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Born for success he seemed, With grace to win, with heart to hold, With shining gifts that took all eyes

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Our knowledge is the amassed thought and experience of innumerable minds.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Only so much do I know, as I have lived

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: How much of human life is lost in waiting.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Women should not be expected to write, or fight, or build, or compose scores; she does all by inspiring men to do all

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No power of genius has ever yet had the smallest success in explaining existence. The perfect enigma remains.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Law rules throughout existence, a Law which is not intelligent, but Intelligence.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Intellectual tasting of life will not supersede muscular activity.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We have more than we use.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The wise through excess of wisdom is made a fool.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is always a best way of doing everything.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The reality is more excellent than the report.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is the privilege of any human work which is well done to invest the doer with a certain haughtiness.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Extremes meet, and there is no better example than the naughtiness of humility

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good

quote: Nature and literature are subjective phenomena; every evil and every good thing is a shadow which we cast

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The great man is not convulsible or tormentable, events pass over him without much impression

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some will always be above others. Destroy the inequality today, and it will appear again tomorrow.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: How painful to give a gift to any person of sensibility, or of equality!  It is next worst to receiving one

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every great and commanding movement in the annals of the world is due to the triumph of enthusiasm. Nothing great was ever achieved without it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: what is a man good for without enthusiasm?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Enthusiasm is the leaping lightning, not to be measured by the horse-power of the understanding.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every great and commanding movement in the annals of the world is a triumph of enthusiasm

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Coal is a portable climate. It carries the heat of the tropics to Labrador and the polar circle; and it is the means of transporting itself whithersoever it is wanted. Watt and Stephenson whispered in the ear of mankind their secret, that a half-ounce of coal will draw two tons a mile, and coal carries coal, by rail and by boat, to make Canada as warm as Calcutta, and with its comfort brings its industrial power.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: An Eastern poet, Ali Ben Abu Taleb, writes with sad truth, He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare, And he who has one enemy shall meet him everywhere

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare, and he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If you would lift me up you must be on higher ground.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Often a certain abdication of prudence and foresight is an element of success.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Knowledge is the only elegance.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All the thoughts of a turtle are turtle

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: That which we do not call education is more precious than that which we call so

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The secret of education lies in respecting the pupil.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A cultivated man, wise to know and bold to perform, is the end to which nature works, and the education of the will is the flowering and result of all this geology and astronomy

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are shut up in schools and college recitation rooms for ten or fifteen years, and come out at last with a belly-full of words and do not know a thing. The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means of education.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Respect the child. Be not too much his parent. Trespass not on his solitude.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are students of words: we are shut up in schools, and colleges, and recitation-rooms, for ten or fifteen years, and come out at last with a bag of wind, a memory of words, and do not know a thing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The future belongs to those who prepare for it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Let every man shovel out his own snow and the whole city will be passable.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do that which is assigned to you and you cannot hope too much or dare too much.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man of genius is privileged only as far as he is genius. His dullness is as insupportable as any other dullness.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Good thoughts are no better than good dreams, unless they be executed.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A little fact is worth a whole limbo of dreams.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I am the doubter and the doubt, / And I the hymn the Brahmin sings.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Don't waste life in doubts and fears; spend yourself on the work before you, well assured that the right performance of this hour's duties will be the best preparation for the hours and ages that will follow it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The disease with which the human mind now labors is want of faith

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If a man knew anything, he would sit in a corner and be modest; but he is such an ignorant peacock, that he goes bustling up and down, and hits on extraordinary discoveries.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The virtues of society are vices of the saint. The terror of reform is the discovery that we must cast away our virtues, or what we have always esteemed such, into the same pit that has consumed our grosser vices.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is very unhappy, but too late to be helped, the discovery we have made, that we exist

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Self-command is the main discipline.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The compensations of calamity are made apparent to the understanding also, after long intervals of time. But the sure years reveal the deep remedial force that underlies all facts.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Knowledge comes by eyes always open and working hands; and there is no knowledge that is not power.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: 'Tis a superstition to insist on a special diet. All is made at last of the same chemical atoms.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I can reason down or deny everything, except this perpetual Belly: feed he must and will, and I cannot make him respectable.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I know of no such unquestionable badge and ensign of a sovereign mind as that of tenacity of purpose...

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The education of the will is the object of our existence.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Sow a thought and you reap an action; sow an act and you reap a habit; sow a habit and you reap a character; sow a character and you reap a destiny.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We forget ourselves and our destinies in health, and the chief use of temporary sickness is to remind us of these concerns.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Those who cannot tell what they desire or expect, still sigh and struggle with indefinite thoughts and vast wishes.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is nothing capricious in nature and the implanting of a desire indicates that its gratification is in the constitution of the creature that feel it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: People wish to be settled; only as far as they are unsettled is there any hope for them

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Can anything be so elegant as to have few wants, and to serve them one's self?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Friends, such as we desire, are dreams and fables.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The ship of heaven guides itself and will not accept a wooden rudder.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A great man stands on God. A small man on a great man.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Democracy becomes a government of bullies tempered by editors.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No matter how often you are defeated, you are born to victory.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We love flattery, even though we are not deceived by it, because it shows that we are of importance enough to be courted

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man in debt is so far a slave.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A person seldom falls sick, but the bystanders are animated with a faint hope that he will die.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Tis man's perdition to be safe, When for the truth he ought to die

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: As soon as there is life there is danger.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The most dangerous thing is illusion.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but deliverance from fear

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A cynic can chill and dishearten with a single word.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man is a little thing while he works by and for himself; but when he gives voice to the rules of love and justice, he is godlike.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The reason why all men honor love is because it looks up, and not down; aspires and not despairs.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love and you shall be loved.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All mankind love a lover

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love and you shall be loved. All love is mathematically just, as much as the two sides of an algebraic equation.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Never self-possessed, or prudent, love is all abandonment.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All mankind loves a lover.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The sun shines and warms and lights us and we have no curiosity to know why this is so; but we ask the reason of all evil, of pain, and hunger, and mosquitoes and silly people

quote: Curiosity is lying in wait for every secret.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is proof of high culture to say the greatest matters in the simplest way

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Blame is safer than praise.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Criticism should not be querulous and wasting, all knife and root-puller, but guiding, instructive, inspiring.

quote: Criticism should not be querulous and wasting, all knife and root-puller, but guiding, instructive, inspiring

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Courtesy Life be not so short but that there is always time for courtesy.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Life is not so short but that there is always time for courtesy

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Half a man's wisdom goes with his courage.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Courage charms us, because it indicates that a man loves an idea better than all things in the world, that he is thinking neither of his bed, nor his dinner, nor his money, but will venture all to put in act the invisible thought of his mind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Half a man's wisdom goes with his courage

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What we seek we shall find; what we flee from flees from us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Courage consists in equality to the problem before us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is a time in every man's education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance; that imitation is suicide; that he must take himself for better, for worse, as his portion; that though the wide universe is full of good, no kernel of

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There comes a time in every man's education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance, that imitation is suicide, that he must take himself for better, or for worse as his portion.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To judge from a single conversation, he made the impression of a narrow and very English mind; of one who paid for his rare elevation by general tameness and conformity. Off his own beat, his opinions were of no value.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Conversation is an art in which a man has all mankind for competitors.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: He who would be a man must therefore be a non-conformist.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds

quote: All successful men have agreed in one thing -- they were causationists. They believed that things went not by luck, but by law; that there was not a weak or a cracked link in the chain that joins the first and last of things.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The virtue in most request is conformity.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: One lesson we learn early, that in spite of seeming difference, men are all of one pattern. In fact, the only sin which we never forgive in each other is difference of opinion.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We know better than we do. We do not yet possess ourselves...

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are the prisoners of ideas.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Insist on yourself; never imitate.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Self-trust is the essence of heroism

quote: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The only prudence in life is concentration.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Solvency is maintained by means of a national debt, on the principle, ''If you will not lend me the money, how can I pay you?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: By persisting in your path, though you forfeit the little, you gain the great.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Sincerity is the highest compliment you can pay.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is one topic peremptorily forbidden to all well-bred, to all rational mortals, namely, their distempers. author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: When the eyes say one thing, and the tongue another, a practiced man relies on the language of the first.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nothing astonishes people so much as common sense and plain dealing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Common sense is as rare as genius, - is the basis of genius

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Society is always taken by surprise at any new example of common sense.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All great masters are chiefly distinguished by the power of adding a second, a third, and perhaps a fourth step in a continuous line. Many a man had taken the first step. With every additional step you enhance immensely the value of your first.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All promise outruns performance.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The perception of the comic is a tie of sympathy with other men, a pledge of sanity, and a protection from those perverse tendencies and gloomy insanities in which fine intellects sometimes lose themselves. author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means of education

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Universities are of course hostile to geniuses, which, seeing and using ways of their own, discredit the routine: as churches and monasteries persecute youthful saints.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The Italians are fond of red clothes, peacock plumes, and embroidery; and I remember one rainy morning in the city of Palermo, the street was ablaze with scarlet umbrellas

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Cunning is strength withheld.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The studious class are their own victims: they are thin and pale, their feet are cold, their heads are hot, the night is without sleep, the day a fear of interruption /pallor, squalor, hunger, and egotism.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: As long as our civilization is essentially one of property, of fences, of exclusiveness, it will be mocked by delusions. author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Civilization depends on morality.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A sufficient measure of civilization is the influence of good women.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Sunday is the core of our civilization, dedicated to thought and reverence.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: In failing circumstances no one can be relied on to keep their integrity.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Shallow people believe in luck and in circumstances; Strong people believe in cause and effect.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Wise men put their trust in ideas and not in circumstances

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The first thing a great person does, is make us realize the insignificance of circumstance.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: God enters by a private door into each individual.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: You shall have joy, or you shall have power, said God; you shall not have both

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We talk of choosing our friends, but friends are self-elected

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nothing external to you has any power over you.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every mind must make its choice between truth and repose. It cannot have both.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We must hold a man amenable to reason for the choice of his daily craft or profession. It is not an excuse any longer for his deeds that they are the custom of his trade. What business has he with an evil trade?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose. Take which you please - you can never have both.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are as much informed of a writer's genius by what he selects as by what he originates.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A child is a curly, dimpled lunatic.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Children are all foreigners.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Sorrow makes us all children again, destroys all differences of intellect. The wisest knows nothing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Our poets are men of talents who sing, and not the children of music

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: England, an old and exhausted island, must one day be contented, like other parents, to be strong only in her children

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is long ere we discover how rich we are. Our history, we are sure, is quite tame: we have nothing to write, nothing to infer. But our wiser years still run back to the despised recollections of childhood, and always we are fishing up some wonderful article out of that pond; until, by and by, we begin to suspect that the biography of the one foolish person we know is, in reality, nothing less than the miniature paraphrase of the hundred volumes of the Universal History.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Repose and cheerfulness are the badge of the gentleman -- repose in energy.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Health is the condition of wisdom, and the sign is cheerfulness, -- an open and noble temper.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: So of cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more it remains.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: People suffer all their life long, under the foolish superstition that they can be cheated. But it is impossible for a person to be cheated by anyone but himself.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No one can cheat you out of ultimate success but yourself.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Each man takes care that his neighbor shall not cheat him.  But a day comes when he begins to care that he does not cheat his neighbor.  Then all goes well -- he has changed his market-cart into a chariot of the sun.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The history of persecution is a history of endeavors to cheat nature, to make water run up hill, to twist a rope of sand.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The alleged power to charm down insanity, or ferocity in beasts, is a power behind the eye

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not tell me of my obligation to put all poor men in good situations. Are they my poor? I tell thee, thou foolish philanthropist, that I grudge the dollar, the dime, the cent, I give to such men as do not belong to me and to whom I do not belong.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The worst of charity is that the lives you are asked to preserve are not worth preserving

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived - that is to have succeeded

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Give no bounties: make equal laws: secure life and prosperity and you need not give alms.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No dignity, no learning, no force of character, can make any stand against good wit

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Society is a masked ball, where every one hides his real character, and reveals it by hiding

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some natures are too good to be spoiled by praise.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: For me, commerce is of trivial import; love, faith, truth of character, the aspiration of man, these are sacred; nor can I detach one duty, like you, from all other duties, and concentrate my forces mechanically on the payment of moneys

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Gross and obscure natures, however decorated, seem impure shambles; but character gives splendor to youth, and awe to wrinkled skin and gray hairs.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A character is like an acrostic or Alexandrian stanza; - read it forward, backward, or across, it still spells the same thing

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some men are born to own, and can animate all their possessions. Others cannot: their owning is not graceful; it seems to be a compromise of their character: they seem to steal their own dividends.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Who you are speaks so loudly I can't hear what you're saying.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Use what language you will, you can never say anything to others but what you are

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Character is higher than intellect.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Don't say things. What you are stands over you the while, and thunders so that I cannot hear what you say to the contrary.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Commerce is of trivial import; love, faith, truth of character, the aspiration of man, these are sacred.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The State must follow, and not lead, the character and progress of the citizen.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A low self-love in the parent desires that his child should repeat his character and fortune.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Character is that which can do without success.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do what you know, and perception is converted into character, as islands and continents were built by invisible infusories, or, as these forest leaves absorb light, electricity, and volatile gases, and the gnarled oak to live a thousand years is the

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Things said for conversation are chalk eggs. Don't say things. What you are stands over you the while, and thunders so that I cannot hear what you say to the contrary.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man is a method, a progressive arrangement, a selecting principle, gathering his like unto him wherever he goes. What you are comes to you.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Heaven sometimes hedges a rare character about with ungainliness and odium, as the burr that protects the fruit

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The force of character is cumulative

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every great institution is the lengthened shadow of a single man. His character determines the character of the organization.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Character - a reserved force which acts directly by presence, and without means.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The maker of a sentence launches out into the infinite and builds a road into Chaos and old Night, and is followed by those who hear him with something of wild, creative delight.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Here is the world, sound as a nut, perfect, not the smallest piece of chaos left, never a stitch nor an end, not a mark of haste, or botching, or second thought; but the theory of the world is a thing of shreds and patches

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every man is a consumer and ought to be a producer.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Valor consists in the power of self recovery.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is always safety in valor.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is braver five minutes longer.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I pay the schoolmaster but 'tis the schoolboys who educate my son

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I pay the schoolmaster, but it is the school boys who educate my son.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Be a little careful about your library. Do you foresee what you will do with it? Very little to be sure. But the real question is, What it will do with you? You will come here and get books that will open your eyes, and your ears, and your curiosity, and turn you inside out or outside in.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is no luck in literary reputation. They who make up the final verdict upon every book are not the partial and noisy readers of the hour when it appears; but a court as of angels, a public not to be bribed, not to be entreated, and not to be overawed, decides upon every man's title to fame.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every burned book or house enlightens the world; every suppressed or expunged word reverberates through the earth from side to side

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Proverbs, like the sacred books of each nation, are the sanctuary of the intuitions

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Consider what you have in the smallest chosen library: a company of the wisest and wittiest men that could be picked out of all civil countries in a thousand years.... The thought which they did not uncover to their bosom friend is here written out in transparent words to us, the strangers of another age.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The profit of books is according to the sensibility of the reader. The profoundest thought or passion sleeps as in a mine, until an equal mind and heart finds and publishes it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every book is a quotation; and every house is a quotation out of all forests and mines and stone quarries; and every man is a quotation from all his ancestors

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: 'Tis the good reader that makes the good book; in every book he finds passages which seem to be confidences or sides hidden from all else and unmistakably meant for his ear; the profit of books is according to the sensibility of the reader; the profound thought or passion sleeps as in a mine, until it is discovered by an equal mind and heart.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some books leave us free and some books make us free.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I do not hesitate to read all good books in translations. What is really best in any book is translatable -- any real insight or broad human sentiment.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Talent alone cannot make a writer. There must be a man behind the book.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are too civil to books. For a few golden sentences we will turn over and actually read a volume of four or five hundred pages.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: In a library we are surrounded by many hundreds of dear friends imprisoned by an enchanter in paper and leathern boxes.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man is known by the books he reads, by the company he keeps, by the praise he gives, by his dress, by his tastes, by his distastes, by the stories he tells, by his gait, by the notion of his eye, by the look of his house, of his chamber; for nothing on earth is solitary but every thing hath affinities infinite.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I suppose every old scholar has had the experience of reading something in a book which was significant to him, but which he could never find again. Sure he is that he read it there, but no one else ever read it, nor can he find it again, though he buy the book and ransack every page.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What's a book? Everything or nothing. The eye that sees it all.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man is known by the books he reads.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I do then with my friends as I do with my books. I would have them where I can find them, but I seldom use them.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Books are for nothing but to inspire.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The colleges, while they provide us with libraries, furnish no professors of books; and I think no chair is so much needed.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There are books which take rank in your life with parents and lovers and passionate experiences, so medicinal, so stringent, so revolutionary, so authoritative.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It requires a great deal of boldness and a great deal of caution to make a great fortune, and when you have it, it requires ten times as much skill to keep it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The human body is a magazine of inventions, the patent office, where are the models from which every hint is taken. All the tools and engines on earth are only extensions of its limbs and senses.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Blame is safer than praise

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: When we quarrel, how we wish we had been blameless.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every man is an impossibility until he is born.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Talent alone cannot make a writer. There must be a man behind the book; a personality which, by birth and quality, is pledged to the doctrines there set forth, and which exists to see and state things so, and not otherwise.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is properly no history; only biography.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Great geniuses have the shortest biographies.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is properly no history; only biography

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I can find my biography in every fable that I read

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: For every benefit you receive a tax is levied.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Those who stay away from the election think that one vote will do no good: 'Tis but one step more to think one vote will do no harm.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: One of the benefits of a college education is to show the boy its little avail.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The desire of gold is not for gold. It is for the means of freedom and benefit.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is greatest to believe and to hope well of the world, because he who does so, quits the world of experience, and makes the world he lives in

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man of good sense but of little faith, whose compassion seemed to lead him to church as often as he went there, said to me; 'that he liked to have concerts, and fairs, and churches, and other public amusements go on

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is a lesson which all history teaches wise men, to put trust in ideas, and not in circumstances.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What terrible questions we are learning to ask! The former men believed in magic, by which temples, cities, and men were swallowed up, and all trace of them gone. We are coming on the secret of a magic which sweeps out of men's minds all vestige of theism and beliefs which they and their fathers held and were framed upon.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The pulpit and the press have many commonplaces denouncing the thirst for wealth, but if men should take these moralists at their word, and leave off aiming to be rich, the moralists would rush to rekindle at all hazards this love of power in the peo

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The world is upheld by the veracity of good men: they make the earth wholesome. They who lived with them found life glad and nutritious. Life is sweet and tolerable only in our belief in such society.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A person will worship something, have no doubt about that. We may think our tribute is paid in secret in the dark recesses of our hearts, but it will out. That which dominates our imaginations and our thoughts will determine our lives, and our character. Therefore, it behooves us to be careful what we worship, for what we are worshipping we are becoming.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: As the Sandwich-Islander believes that the strength and valor of the enemy he kills passes into himself, so we gain the strength of the temptations we resist

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If you believe in fate, believe in it, at least, for your own good

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor thejoy of companionship? it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when hediscovers that someone else believes in him and is willing to trust him with hisfriendship.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All the great ages have been ages of belief.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: They can conquer who believe they can. He has not learned the first lesson in life who does not every day surmount a fear.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The eloquent man is he who is no eloquent speaker, but who is inwardly drunk with a certain belief

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it's the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when he discovers that someone else believes in him and is willing to trust him with his friend.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The believing we do something when we do nothing is the first illusion of tobacco.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: For there is nothing settled in manners, but the laws of behavior yield to the energy of the individual

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Treat a man as he is, and he will remain as he is. Treat a man as he could be, and he will become what he should be.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The line of beauty is the line of perfect economy.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: How cunningly nature hides every wrinkle of her inconceivable antiquity under roses and violets and morning dew!

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not waste yourself in rejection; do not bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty without expression is boring.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: But in the mud and scum of things, There always,  something sings

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If eyes were made for seeing, then beauty is its own excuse for being

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A beautiful woman is a picture which drives all beholders nobly mad.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We find a delight in the beauty and happiness of children, that makes the heart too big for the body

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: When I first open my eyes upon the morning meadows and look out upon the beautiful world, I thank God I am alive

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty is the mark God sets on virtue. Every natural action is graceful; every heroic act is also decent, and causes the place and the bystanders to shine.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every thing is beautiful seen from the point of the intellect, or as truth. But all is sour if seen as experience.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: He built better than he knew; - / The conscious stone to beauty grew.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Truth, and goodness, and beauty, are but different faces of the same All

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To the attentive eye, each moment of the year has its own beauty, and in the same field, it beholds, every hour, a picture which was never seen before, and which shall never be seen again

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty rests on necessities.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Each moment of the year has its own beauty, a picture which was never seen before, and which shall never be seen again.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We ascribe beauty to that which is simple; which has no superfluous parts; which exactly answers its end; which stands related to all things; which is the mean of many extremes.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The adventitious beauty of poetry may be felt in the greater delight with a verse given in a happy quotation than in the poem.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Then beauty is its own excuse for being.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Light is the first of painters. There is no object so foul that intense light will not make it beautiful.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty is the mark God sets on virtue.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is one of the most beautiful compensations of life, that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some thoughts always find us young, and keep us so. Such a thought is the love of the universal and eternal beauty.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is said that the world is in a state of bankruptcy, that the world owes the world more than the world can pay.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The best lightning rod for your protection is your own spine.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Good and bad are but names very readily transferable to that or this; the only right is what is after my constitution, the only wrong what is against it

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Them meaning of good and bad, of better and worse, is simply helping or hurting.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Good is a good doctor, but Bad is sometimes a better

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Infancy conforms to nobody: all conform to it, so that one babe commonly makes four or five out of the adults who prattle and play to it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Condense some daily experience into a glowing symbol and an audience is electrified.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A painter told me that nobody could draw a tree without in some sort becoming a tree; or draw a child by studying the outlines of its form merely . . . but by watching for a time his motions and plays, the painter enters into his nature and can then draw him at every attitude . . .

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: As long as a man stands in his own way, everything seems to be in his way.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Trust men and they will be true to you;  treat them greatly and they will show themselves great

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The wonder is always new that any sane man can be a sailor.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The most advanced nations are always those who navigate the most.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Genius is its own end, and draws its means and the style of its architecture from within, going abroad only for audience, and spectator, as we adapt our voice and phrase to the distance and character of the ear we speak to

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Art is a jealous mistress, and if a man has a genius for painting, poetry, music, architecture or philosophy, he makes a bad husband and an ill provider.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Art is a jealous mistress, and, if a man have a genius for painting, poetry, music, architecture, or philosophy, he makes a bad husband, and an ill provider, and should be wise in season, and not fetter himself with duties which will embitter his day

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To fill the hour, that is happiness;  to fill the hour, and leave no crevice for a repentance or an approval

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and stare.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every man supposes himself not to be fully understood or appreciated.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Health and appetite impart the sweetness to sugar, bread, and meat

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: People that seem so glorious are all show; underneath they are like everyone else.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We first share the life by which things exist, and afterwards see them as appearances in nature, and forget that we have shared their cause

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A beautiful form is better than a beautiful face; it gives a higher pleasure than statues or pictures; it is the finest of the fine arts.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is the soundness of the bones that ultimates itself in the peach- bloom complexion

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The judge weighs the arguments and puts a brave face on the matter, and since there must be a decision, decides as he can, and hopes he has done justice and given satisfaction to the community

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: 'Tis very certain that each man carries in his eye the exact indication of his rank in the immense scale of men, and we are always learning to read it. A complete man should need no auxiliaries to his personal presence.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The President has paid dear for his White House. It has commonly cost him all his peace, and the best of his manly attributes. To preserve for a short time so conspicuous an appearance before the world, he is content to eat dust before the real masters who stand erect behind the throne.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is no beautifier of complexion, or form, or behavior, like the wish to scatter joy and not pain around us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is only when the mind and character slumber that dress can be seen.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty is the pilot of the young soul.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature never wears a mean appearance. When we speak of nature in this manner, we have a distinct but most poetical sense of mind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What a new face courage puts on everything!

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Culture is one thing and varnish is another.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Those who live to the future must always appear selfish to those who live to the present

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every fact is related on one side to sensation, and, on the other, to morals. The game of thought is, on the appearance of one of these two sides, to find the other; given the upper, to find the under side.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is no beautifier of complexion, or form, or behaviour, like the wish to scatter joy and not pain around us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Some of your grief you have cured, and lived to survive; but what torments of pain have you endured that haven't as yet arrived.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The solar system has no anxiety about its reputation

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The walking of man and all animals, is a falling forward

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A good indignation brings out all one's powers.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man makes inferiors his superiors by heat; self-control is the rule.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Men lose their tempers in defending their taste

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A man is a God in ruins.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Each of the arts whose office is to refine, purify, adorn, embellish and grace life is under the patronage of a muse, no god being found worthy to preside over them.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: In America the geography is sublime, but the men are not; the inventions are excellent, but the inventors one is sometimes ashamed of.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The less America looks abroad, the grander its promise

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: America is a country of young men

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: I hate this shallow Americanism which hopes to get rich by credit, to get knowledge by raps on midnight tables, to learn the economy of the mind by phrenology, or skill without study, or mastery without apprenticeship.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We are a puny and fickle folk. Avarice, hesitation, and following are our diseases.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All diseases run into one. Old age.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The key to the age may be this, or that, or the other, as the young orators describe; the key to all ages is -- Imbecility; imbecility in the vast majority of men, at all times, and, even in heroes, in all but certain eminent moments; victims of gravity, custom, and fear.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We do not count a man's years until he has nothing else to count.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If there is any period one would desire to be born in, is it not the age of Revolution; when the old and the new stand side by side...when the glories of the old can be compensated by the rich possibilities of the new era? This time...is a very good one..

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Getting old is a fascination thing. The older you get, the older you want to get.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Congratulate yourselves if you have done something strange and extravagant and broken the monotony of a decorous age

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The experience of each new age requires a new confession, and the world seems always waiting for its poet

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature is full of freaks, and now puts an old head on young shoulders, and then takes a young heart heating under fourscore winters.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Wherever there is power there is age.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: In the great books of India, an empire spoke to us, nothing small or unworthy, but large, serene, consistent, the voice of an old intelligence, which in another age and climate had pondered and thus disposed of the questions that exercise us

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Men over forty are no judges of a book written in a new spirit.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every reform was once a private opinion, and when it shall be a private opinion again, it will solve the problem of the age.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If there is any period one would desire to be born in, is it not the age of Revolution; when the old and the new stand side by side, and admit of being compared; when the energies of all men are searched by fear and by hope; when the historic glories of the old can be compensated by the rich possibilities of the new era?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The moment we indulge our affections, the earth is metamorphosed, there is no winter and no night; all tragedies, all ennui s, vanish, all duties even.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To laugh often and much; to win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children; to earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends; to appreciate beauty; to find the best in others; to leave the world a bit better, whether by a healthy child, a garden patch or a redeemed social condition; to know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Who can guess how much industry and providence and affection we have caught from the pantomime of brutes?

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To laugh often and much;to win the respect of intelligent peopleand the affection of children;to earn the appreciation of honest criticsand endure the betrayal of false friends;to appreciate beauty;to find the best in others;to leave the world a bit better,whether by a healthy child,a garden patch or a redeemed social condition;to know even one life has breathed easierbecause you have lived.This is to have succeeded.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The moment we indulge our affections, the earth is metamorphosed, there is no winter and no night; all tragedies, all ennui, vanish, - all duties even

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To laugh often and much; to win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children...to leave the world a better place...to know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Be silly. Be honest. Be kind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: In every society some men are born to rule, and some to advise.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Sprinkle joy.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Wilt thou seal up the avenues of ill? Pay every debt as if God wrote the bill.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The three practical rules, then, which I have to offer, are,  --/ Never read a book that is not a year old./ Never read any but the famed books./ Never read any but what you like.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It was a high counsel that I once heard given to a young person, Always do what you are afraid to do

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Finish each day before you begin the next, and interpose a solid wall of sleep between the two. This you cannot do without temperance.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Better to be a nettle in the side of your friend than his echo.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is this benefit in brag, that the speaker is unconsciously expressing his own ideal. Humor him by all means; draw it all out, and hold him to it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We must set up a strong present tense against all rumors of wrath, past and to come.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Heartily know, When half-gods go, The gods arrive

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love, and you shall be loved

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: That which we call character is a reserved force which acts directly by presence, and without means. It is conceived of as a certain undemonstrable force, a familiar or genius, by whose impulses the man is guided, but whose counsels he cannot impart.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in, forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day, you shall begin it well and serenely...

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Adopt the pace of nature; her secret is patience.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that, you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Never read any book that is not a year old

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every man has his own courage, and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Don't be a cynic and disconsolate preacher. Don't bewail and moan. Omit the negative propositions. Challenge us with incessant affirmatives. Don't waste yourself in rejection, or bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Guard well your spare moments. They are like uncut diamonds. Discard them and their value will never be known. Improve them and they will become the brightest gems in a useful life.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To know how to suggest is the great art of teaching.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There are people who have an appetite for grief; pleasure is not strong enough and they crave pain. They have mithridatic stomachs which must be fed on poisoned bread, natures so doomed that no prosperity can sooth their ragged and dishevelled desolation.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Poverty, Frost, Famine, Rain, Disease, are the beadles and guardsmen that hold us to Common Sense.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: He that can heroically endure adversity will bear prosperity with equal greatest of the soul; for the mind that cannot be dejected by the former is not likely to be transported without the latter.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Out of love and hatred, out of earnings and borrowings and leadings and losses; out of sickness and pain; out of wooing and worshipping; out of traveling and voting and watching and caring; out of disgrace and contempt, comes our tuition in the serene and beautiful laws.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. He may as well concern himself with his shadow on the wall.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Be not the slave of your own past ... plunge into the sublime seas, dive deep, and swim far, so you shall come back with self-respect, with new power, with an advanced experience, that shall explain and overlook the old.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The true artist has the planet for his pedestal; the adventurer, after years of strife, has nothing broader than his shoes

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not go where the path may lead; go instead where there is no path and leave a trail

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every advantage has its tax.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We must be courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Noblesse oblige; or, superior advantages bind you to larger generosity

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature has made up her mind that what cannot defend itself shall not be defended.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: They have in themselves what they value in their horse, mettle and bottom

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If a man write a better book, preach a better sermon, or make a better mouse-trap than his neighbor, tho' he build his house in the woods, the world will make a beaten path to his door.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We live by our imagination, our admiration s, and our sentiments.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The youth, intoxicated with his admiration of a hero, fails to see, that it is only a projection of his own soul, which he admires

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If the stars should appear just one night in a thousand years, how would men believe and adore!

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We do not live an equal life, but one of contrasts and patchwork; now a little joy, then a sorrow, now a sin, then a generous or brave action

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: There is a tendency for things to right themselves.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Vigor is contagious, and whatever makes us either think or feel strongly adds to our power and enlarges our field of action

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Things are in the saddle, And ride mankind

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not believe that possibly you can escape the reward of your action.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The world is full of judgment-days, and into every assembly that a man enters, in every action he attempts, he is gauged and stamped.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: This gives force to the strong -- that the multitude have no habit of self-reliance or original action.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Line in nature is not found; Unit and universe are round; In vain produced, all rays return; Evil will bless, and ice will burn

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
